utterances: It's very unusual that the producers are that good at wrapping things and giving so many good answers.

And they literally buried the main character.
Can you keep all that stuff straight?
Can you keep all of those characters straight?
You have to watch every week, though.
It was fun last year, just as we learned that, you know, Jennifer Garner's new husband, or the father of her child, was not who we was supposed to be…
…it was one of the great car crashes in TV history.
You know, and then, in the second season, poor Sydney, she just wakes up and discovers that she's been missing for two years.
And we have to wait all summer to find out, what's up with that?
Well, I guess now we're going to have to wait the rest of our lives to find out what happens to them.

Ann with us from Novato, California.
And she's got another little critic there with her.
He does what most of us do when we watch a lot of television programs: cry.
Well, I just have a comment.
I was a big, big fan of the Gilmore Girls.
It was sort of a guilty pleasure for me.
And this year, the season finale, I will never watch the show again.
A lot of people say that this year they were disappointed because Lorelai hopped back into bed with Chris, who is the father of Rory.
But the point of that is is that that just sets up next year, where she'll hop out of bed and run after Luke.
Scott Patterson's been signed for next year.
Rory's boyfriend went off to Europe; he'll be back.
For me, that just made me more interested in what's going to happen.
But I just loved Luke and Lorelai so much.
It was so hot to see them.
Gilmore girls, it's totally a real show.
Everything on it is based in fact.
All those people wandering around the little gazebo in that town.
And I would love to live in Stars Hollow, if I could.
I'd want to live right next door to Miss Patty.
The bad thing about that show is the people that've been writing it all these years are not going to be back next year.
So it'll be interesting to see what the fill-in group does.
